page.title: 16THE NEW ARRIVALS
page.content: We interviewed eight people who had not been brought up in the village .Most of them had moved here in the last two years, the most recent arrived two months ago.They come from all over Britain, Scotland, Wales, Gloucester, Durham, Bedford and others parts of Yorkshire.One of them runs a business in the village but others wanted to be near to where they worked,Leeds for example, which is thirty miles away.Everyone liked the country side ,the people here are friendly.The new houses are popular and the school is near. S ome people chose to retire here. The people we interviewed were pleased with their new life. The elderly newcomers find it peaceful and quiet. RESEARCHED BY Darran Furnass, Yvonne McKenzie,Paul Sanderson & Michelle Simpson.
